bibl.title: Edward Crofery v. O. D. Butterfield. Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Territory of Washington, County of King. ss.
O. D. Butterfield, being first duly sworn on oath, says; that he is the Chief of Police of the City of Seattle, King County, Washington Territoru; that, on to-wit, the 8th. day of May, 1889, he received information from a person in the said City of Seattle, whose name is to affiant unknown, that the said Edward Crofery and Howard Mcmillan had committed the crime of burglary, at the City of Vancouver, in the provice of British Columbia, and was then and thre requested to arrest and hold them until the 11th. day of MAy, 1889, when the United States martial of the Territory of Washington went to the City jail, in said City of Seattle, and took the said Edward Crofery and Howard Mc.Millan from the jailer of said City by virtue of a warrant issued out of the United States Commisioners' Court, at the City of Seattle, upon the charge of bringing smuggled goods into the United States; that the said Edward Crofery and Howard Mc.Millan are now in the custody and under the control of the said United States martial of Washington Territory, adn this affiant is therefore unable to produce them before this honorable Court. That this affiant held said parties for the period of time aforesaid, under and by virtue of two telegrams received from the Cheif of Police of the City of Vancouver, British Columbiua, which are hereto attached, and made a part of this return. That said prisoners were taken from the said City Jailor befoer the writ of aveas Corpus herein was served in this affiant. O. D. Butterfield Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th. day of May, 1889. S. H. Piles Notary Public in and for Wash. Terr. O D Butterfield Resworn to before me this 11th day of May, 1889 S H Piles Notary Public Chief of Police

E T No. 6775
Writ of Habeas Corpus and Return of Chief of Police du reference to the arrest and custody of our Edward Cofery
FILED MAY 11 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. By. H T Harmon Deputy Clerk.
